qa_pairs.question: What were the key professional and academic roles held by James F. Rothenberg, and which institutions did he contribute to through donations or leadership positions?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>James F. Rothenberg served as president and director of Capital Research and Management Co., a principal subsidiary of the Capital Group Companies Inc., and as an investment adviser to American Funds.<cite>[S1][S4][S5]</cite></statement> <statement>He was an alumnus of Harvard College and Harvard Business School and a member of the Harvard Corporation at the time of his death.<cite>[S6]</cite></statement> <statement>Rothenberg served as the University's treasurer until 2014, when he was replaced by Paul Finnegan.<cite>[S7]</cite></statement> <statement>He was a trustee of the California Institute of Technology and donated $15 million to Caltech in March 2015.<cite>[S8]</cite></statement> <statement>Rothenberg also held a leadership position as a member of the Committee on Capital Markets Regulation.<cite>[S9]</cite></statement>
qa_pairs.chunk:
Passage 1:
[S1] James F. [S2] Rothenberg


# James F. [S3] Rothenberg



**James Frederic Rothenberg** CFA (July 16, 1946 – July 21, 2015), "a leading figure in the investment world", served as president and director of Capital Research and Management Co. [S4] (a principal subsidiary of the Capital Group Companies Inc.) and as investment adviser to American Funds. [S5] Born in Pittsburgh, Rothenberg was an alumnus of both Harvard College and Harvard Business School and at the time of his death was a member of the Harvard Corporation. [S6] Until he was replaced by Paul Finnegan in 2014, he had also served as the University's treasurer. [S7] He was a trustee of the California Institute of Technology and donated $15 million to Caltech in March, 2015. [S8] He was also a member of the Committee on Capital Markets Regulation. [S9] ## Death

Rothenberg died on July 21, 2015, aged 69, of a heart attack.

[S5] Born in Pittsburgh, Rothenberg was an alumnus of both Harvard College and Harvard Business School and at the time of his death was a member of the Harvard Corporation. [S6] Until he was replaced by Paul Finnegan in 2014, he had also served as the University's treasurer. [S7] He was a trustee of the California Institute of Technology and donated $15 million to Caltech in March, 2015. [S8] He was also a member of the Committee on Capital Markets Regulation. [S9] ## Death

Rothenberg died on July 21, 2015, aged 69, of a heart attack.

qa_pairs.question: In what ways did James F. Rothenberg's career intersect with both the financial and academic sectors, and how did his roles evolve over time?

Rothenberg's career intersected with the financial sector through his roles as president and director of Capital Research and Management Co., a principal subsidiary of the Capital Group Companies Inc., and as an investment adviser to American Funds.<cite>[S4][S5]</cite></statement> <statement>He also engaged with the academic sector as a member of the Harvard Corporation and until 2014, as the University's treasurer, while serving as a trustee of the California Institute of Technology and donating $15 million to Caltech in 2015.<cite>[S6][S7][S8]</cite></statement> <statement>Rothenberg's roles evolved over time, transitioning from financial leadership positions to academic governance and philanthropy, with his academic involvement culminating in his trustee role at Caltech and his continued membership in the Committee on Capital Markets Regulation.<cite>[S7][S8][S9]</cite></statement>
